column2: Quick Start to Rigging in Maya: Volume 1
column5: Welcome to the Quick Start to Rigging in Maya. Wex27ll go through Mayax27s rigging tools in a very methodical way, making sure to cover the tools and techniques that are most important in enabling you to get up and running quickly. Each volume of a Quick Start will build upon the previous volume, enabling us to progressively build up a complex project into a finished state. In this initial volume, wex27ll cover the basics of getting started with the rigging tools in Maya. Wex27ll learn how to create joints and work with Inverse Kinematics. Wex27ll cover skinning tools and ways to improve our deformations with time-saving techniques. Wex27ll also learn about constraints, how to set up control objects, and how to build systems with Driven Keys. While building a project together, youx27ll be provided with valuable knowledge, and the real power comes from being able to take the techniques youx27ve learned and apply them in a different way to your own work.

column2: Building a Better Business Case – Building a Better Business
column5:
Hi, my name is Lawrence T. Barnard, and I’d like to introduce you to my course, Building a Better Business Case-Building a Better Business. 

I’m a certified management consultant and CEO of Explorus Group Inc. I’ve spent my life helping global organizations manage their never-ending change. 

The best tool used by organizations around the world to introduce change is the formal document called a “Business Case.” 

In this course, we’ll look at some of the essential components to building an effective business case by focusing on the things that you’ll rarely hear about in business management training. 

Some of the major topics we’ll cover include: 
1.	Tying the Business Case to project management 
2.	Leveraging a business case triage 
3.	Framing your business case scope to optimize value to the organization 
4.	Standardizing your approach to risk management x26 
5.	Applying international best practices when developing metrics for your business case 

By the end of this course, you’ll be able to build an amazing business case that provides value, frames the right scope and helps decision makers understand risks, complexity and forecasted benefits. 

This is an advanced course that benefits from at least a basic understanding of the organization from an enterprise level, along with business analysis and project management experience.  

I hope you’ll join me on this adventure to learn more about the art and science of creating an exemplary business case, with Building a Better Business Case-Building a Better Business at Pluralsight.

Clips: M6-04 ; M3-09 ; M1-05

column2: Web vs Apps: The Big Picture

As we go to build such solutions, we have found people quickly come to the big question: Web, or native app? In this course we will try to tear apart that question and get to the nuance that lies within.
